summary:
Brandenburg is a state in northeastern Germany, bordering Poland and several other German states. With a population of 2.5 million, its capital is Potsdam. Brandenburg surrounds Berlin, and together they form a large metropolitan area.

Historically, Brandenburg was part of the Holy Roman Empire and later became a province of Prussia. After World War II, it was dissolved but then re-established in 1990 during German reunification. Some areas of Brandenburg have two official languages: German and Lower Sorbian.
title: Brandenburg
